en.li_1: Obtain two cells to pass this stage
en.li_2: Obtain four cells to pass this stage
en.li_3: Obtain six cells to pass this stage
en.stagewin: Exelent job! Keep the life growing!
en.levelwin_1: Exelent job! You are a bacteria expert!
en.levelwin_2: Exelent job! You are a expert on plant cells!
en.levelwin_3: Exelent job! You are a expert on animal cells!
en.stagelose: Oh, no! It´s not easy to get by this tiny world
en.levelsaveopt_1: Those mean viruses... But don't worry!
en.levelsaveopt_2: Maybe, if you can answer this question you can get back in a flash to keep those cells growing!
en.correct_save: Excelent! Wasn't expecting less from you
en.incorrect_save: Oh my, I guess that you should restart the level
en.ct_1_1: Hello there! Welcome to my laboratory
en.ct_1_2: Cells are tiny, so tiny that we need a MICROSCOPE to be able to see them...
en.ct_1_3: The CELL is the most basic unit that can be classified as a LIVING THING
en.ct_1_4: All organisms contain at least one CELL
en.ct_1_5: Organisms with only one cell are called UNICELLULAR organisms
en.ct_1_6: When a cell does not have a defined nucleus, it is called a PROKARYOTE cell
en.ct_1_7: Bacteria, Archaea, and most protist are UNICELLULAR and PROKARYOTE
en.tt_1_1: Click on a CELL to select it and view its ATP bar
en.tt_1_2: Click somewhere else to move it there
en.tt_1_3: Pass next to smaller molecules to absorb them
en.tt_1_4: PROTEINS to grow up and reproduce
en.tt_1_5: Double click on a fully grown cell to divide it by MITOSIS
en.tt_1_6: GLUCOSE to break it and recharge your cells ATP energy bar
en.tt_1_7: OXYGEN is needed but bacteria can do without it by FERMENTATION
en.tt_1_8: Click repeatedly on cell to excrete an absorbed virus before is too late!
en.ct_2_1: Animals and plants are MULTICELLULAR organisms; they have MILLONS of cells!
en.ct_2_2: EUKARYOTIC cells have a nucleus where the DNA is located
en.ct_2_3: These cells are found in Animals, Plants, Fungi and some protists
en.ct_2_4: EUKARYOTIC cells also have ORGANELLES inside them
en.ct_2_5: These ORGANELLES help the CELL to perform the basic functions of life:
en.tt_2_1: Put your cells under a beam of light to create GLUCOSE, this process is called PHOTOSYNTHESIS
en.tt_2_2: To break that GLUCOSE you need to absorb OXYGEN particles first
en.ct_3_1: Humans have about 200 different types of specialized cells that make up the different tissues, organs, and systems in our body”
en.s_q_1_1: Esta es una pregunta de salvataje
en.s_q_2_1: Esta es una pregunta de salvataje 2
